title: Make MYL fully installable as an Android Chrome PWA (manifest + service worker + standalone)

requirements.text: Update the web app manifest at `frontend/public/manifest.json` to match the MYL branding and Chrome installability requirements: set `name` to "MYL", `short_name` to "MYL", `background_color` to "#ffffff", `theme_color` to "#6A0DAD", `display` to "standalone", and ensure the `icons` array includes valid PNG entries for exactly 192x192 and 512x512 using the generated MYL bullseye icon files.

quotes: Create and connect a proper manifest.json.
App settings: Name: MYL; Short name: MYL; Background: white; Theme color: purple (#6A0DAD)
Make sure icons 192x192 and 512x512 are created and the app passes Chrome PWA install criteria.

acceptanceCriteria: `/manifest.json` loads without errors in Chrome DevTools → Application → Manifest.
Manifest shows: Name=MYL, Short name=MYL, Background color=#ffffff, Theme color=#6A0DAD, Display=standalone.
Manifest includes at least one 192x192 PNG icon and one 512x512 PNG icon that load successfully (no 404).

requirements.text: Update `frontend/index.html` PWA-related tags to align with the MYL PWA configuration: set `<meta name="theme-color">` to `#6A0DAD`; update any PWA app-name meta tags (e.g., `apple-mobile-web-app-title`, `application-name`) to "MYL"; and ensure the manifest link remains present and correct (`<link rel="manifest" href="/manifest.json" />`).

quotes: Create and connect a proper manifest.json.

acceptanceCriteria: Chrome DevTools → Application → Manifest reflects the updated theme color and app name metadata without warnings caused by missing/invalid manifest linkage.
The HTML document contains a manifest link to `/manifest.json` and a theme-color meta tag set to `#6A0DAD`.

requirements.text: Ensure the service worker is enabled and registered so that Chrome (Android) considers the app installable: keep or adjust the existing service worker registration in `frontend/index.html` so it registers `/sw.js` in secure contexts, and ensure `frontend/public/sw.js` includes an active `fetch` handler and successfully controls the page after reload.

quotes: Enable and register a service worker so the app meets Chrome installation criteria.
Make sure the “Install app” option appears in Chrome on Android.

acceptanceCriteria: In Chrome DevTools → Application → Service Workers, `/sw.js` shows as "activated and is running".
After a normal reload, `navigator.serviceWorker.controller` is non-null.
The service worker script contains a `self.addEventListener('fetch', ...)` handler.

requirements.text: Configure the app so that when installed from Chrome on Android it launches in standalone mode (no browser UI), and verify installability signals are satisfied so Chrome shows an installation entry (e.g., "Install app") in the Android Chrome menu.

quotes: Configure the app so when installed it opens in standalone mode, without the browser bar.
Make sure the “Install app” option appears in Chrome on Android.

acceptanceCriteria: When installed on Android Chrome, launching MYL opens without the browser address bar (standalone).
On Android Chrome, the overflow menu includes an install option (e.g., "Install app") when visiting the site over HTTPS (or localhost during testing).

constraints: Do not change any other application behavior or features beyond PWA installability/branding changes.
Do not modify files under `frontend/src/components/ui` or any paths listed as immutable by the system context.
nonGoals: Adding new non-PWA features, screens, flows, or backend changes.
Implementing push notifications, background sync, or offline-first product changes beyond what is required for Chrome PWA installability.

required: Minimalist purple bullseye/target icon on white background, flat geometric lines, no shadows or gradients, centered (myl-bullseye-icon.dim_192x192.png)
Minimalist purple bullseye/target icon on white background, flat geometric lines, no shadows or gradients, centered (myl-bullseye-icon.dim_512x512.png)
